Observed output of cmd `create_chat_completion` executed:
The first place mentioned by name in the Book of Esther, according to the New International Version (NIV), is Persia. In April 1977, the Prime Minister of Iran, which was historically known as Persia, was Amir Abbas Hoveyda. He served as Prime Minister from January 1965 until August 1977 under Shah Mohammed Reza Pahlavi. Therefore, in April 1977, the Prime Minister of the first place mentioned in the Book of Esther was Amir Abbas Hoveyda.

Observed output of cmd `create_chat_completion` executed:
The first place mentioned by name in the Book of Esther, according to the New International Version (NIV), is Persia. In April 1977, the Prime Minister of Iran, which was historically known as Persia, was Amir Abbas Hoveyda. He served as Prime Minister from January 1965 until August 1977 under Shah Mohammed Reza Pahlavi. Therefore, in April 1977, the Prime Minister of the first place mentioned in the Book of Esther was Amir Abbas Hoveyda.
